evidence: with a polarized radio tracer, the emission becomes directionally dependent

concepts.term: flip this polarization vector - sometimes called the M vector

evidence: with a polarized radio tracer, the emission becomes directionally dependent. That means the gamma rays are no longer isotropic - they are preferentially emitted along specific directions.
